name: Shalom Hotel & Relax Tel Aviv - an Atlas Boutique Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We have just returned from a 7 night stay at the Shalom and Relax and I cannot recommend this hotel highly enough. Muriel
reviews.title: A Gem of a Hotel

reviews.text: Attentive and pleasant staff. lovely clean and crisp decor. very comfortable beds. absolutely delicious breakfast with relaxing music in the background. blown away by made to order capuccino. enjoyed peaceful morning moments up on the roof. would not hesitate to recommend hotel to friends.
reviews.title: very pleasant stay

reviews.text: A little far north near the monolithic Hilton a block from the beach. Comfortable but overall average room and bath.
reviews.title: Good choice

reviews.text: Very helpful front desk, great breakfast, very pleasant cinq-a-sept most days and free 15 minute massages at awkward times of the day.
reviews.title: Wonderful little hotel!

reviews.text: This hotel is truly a gem in Tel Aviv. A very short walk to the beach and a good location. A few specialties worth mentioning are the wonderful rooftop terrace, the free happy hour with snacks and drinks every day, and the free massages (although we didn't get to try that, due to our full schedules). It was a bit more expensive than most hotels in the area, but it was so worth it that we decided to extend our stay by one night. We had a room behind the front desk, but it was a very nice and quiet room (no view, though). When we decided to stay another night, we had the option of switching rooms but decided not to do that. The bathroom was on the small side, but perfectly adequate for our needs. All staff members were very friendly and attentive.
reviews.title: Lovely!

reviews.text: I spent a great week at this hotel. The breakfast is a real feast, the staff are kind and attentive to your needs and the rooms are spotless. I hired a bike from the hotel to explore the city and follow the cycle tracks along the sea to Jaffa.
reviews.title: A warm welcome, the charm of a small hotel and friendly staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The wall computer / TV in the rooms is fine but if you need to use a computer a lot, I suggest taking your own. Everything else was wonderful.
reviews.title: Deserves it's #1 distinction

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Had a wonderful experience at the Shalom Hotel.
reviews.title: Very nice hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Rooms are lovely, service is exceptional, food is fresh and
reviews.title: Delightful Mediterranean Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at Shalom & Relax hotel for the weekend. The hotel has a great location close to the beach, Tel Aviv port and lots of restaurants.
reviews.title: Warm, romantic & great location

reviews.text: Breakfast has a wide varaiety and is very tasty. The stuff are helpful and welcoming and the room is very comfortable.
reviews.title: Mükemmel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Highly recommended!
reviews.title: one of the best hotels i have ever been

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Wonderful Hotel,especially with Simone and her team.You feel yourself at home.Simone is great!
reviews.title: An Excellent boutique hotel!

reviews.text: Luxurious Boutique hotel,
reviews.title: Gorgeous boutique hotel

reviews.text: A nice boutique hotel, if you don't mind small rooms. The service was very friendly. We had an extra person, and they only charged us for an extra breakfast. The breakfast is very nice, and they have a nice afternoon snack. WIFI is free, and accessible on the TV in your room. They have a parking arrangement with the large Hilton across the street. It costs 40 shekels (about $10 US) to leave the parking, regardless of how long you stay. All in all, we were quite happy with this hotel.
reviews.title: very happy with this hotel

reviews.text: We"ve stayed at this hotel last december,a family of 2 adults and 2 kids,in two adjoinning rooms.
reviews.title: well located,nice decoration,too tiny rooms

reviews.text: Good points:well located,one of the best hotel breakfests i have ever tasted,nice decoration.
reviews.title: As the name says...

reviews.text: Bad points:the rooms are very small and so are the bathroom,at the point that no one could get in the shower with the box closed(after more than one night stay this started to bother),service just average,too pricey for the quality of the stay.
reviews.title: a great find

reviews.text: I would not rate it as the #1 in Tel Aviv,ever.Next time in TA i would rather one of the big chains hotels next to the beach.
reviews.title: Very nice hotel in the center of Tel Aviv

reviews.text: We (2 families, each with 2 adult children) stayed at the Shalom Hotel the last few nights of a 9 day Israel trip. We loved everything about this hotel, from the staff to the breakfast to the location. It's across the street from a park and the beach. Dizengoff Street, a main drag, is a couple blocks away where you can find many stores, cafes and restaurants.
reviews.title: WIsh I could have stayed longer

reviews.text: During the week they have a complimentary cocktail hour, which is a nice way to unwind from a long day of sight-seeing. Upon checkup, each family was given a bottle of wine. We picked up some cheese, crackers and other hor d'oeuvres at a nearby cheese shop, and had our own happy hour on their delightful roof deck on our last night.
reviews.title: Shalom : Good boutique hotel Near Beach. Not Perfect, but good

reviews.text: We thoroughly enjoyed our stay at Hotel Shalom but unfortunately we had packed in so much during our stay in Israel (all first timers), we did not have nearly enough time to relax and enjoy all that Tel Aviv has to offer.
reviews.title: Shhhhhhhhh don't tell anyone!

reviews.text: I stayed here for 2 nights last week as part of a business trip to tel aviv.
reviews.title: Excellent choice!

reviews.text: It is conveniently located for the beach and accessible to Central Tel Aviv via easily obtained taxis.
reviews.title: Cozy, yet modern

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: All these reviews are not wrong. This is a glorious place to stay with a great location across from the beach and Independence Park.
reviews.title: Small Boutique Hotel with Great Service

reviews.text: I would like to say that the greeting upon arrival was first class, a strawberry and warm cider. What I will always remember about this hotel is the wonderful smell throughout the hotel. The breakfast buffet was excellent. We got some wonderful restaurant recommendations among them was Ernesto, an Italian restaurant that imported all it's cheeses from Italy. The big chains do not compare to this hotel.
reviews.title: Gorgeous roooms, breakfast...rooftop... all gorgeous...!

reviews.text: Me & my pal stayed here in March 2011... It was a glorious experience... On arrival at 4am we were greeted with hot cider... The breakfast was delicious... The rooms & bathroom's, lovely... It was a fantastic stay.... Good idea to take coffee's to the rooftop... Would well recommend this hotel, it made our stay in Tel Aviv... !
reviews.title: We have found a home in Tel Aviv

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I just returned from a visit with our daughter who is completing a "gap" program in Israel. Four of our seven nights in Israel we stayed in Tel Aviv at the Shalom Hotel. We are hopeful that we will be back in Israel, and if we are, we will absolutely stay at the Shalom. It is particularly attractive of a destination when compared to the lager luxury chain hotels. During the portion of the stay when we were in Jerusalem we stayed at the Dan Panorama - a very nice hotel, but when compared to the warm environment which can only come from a boutique, it doesn't stand a chance in comparison.
reviews.title: Very friendly and well organized

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: All aspects of the hotel were tremendous. I will just highlight some of the particularly pleasing aspects:
reviews.title: Fantastic

aka: Shalom Hotel And Relax Tel Aviv - An Atlas Boutique Hotel
description: The Shalom Hotel & Relax offers 51 rooms designed to pamper guests that want to enjoy the resort atmosphere of Tel Aviv, Israel. Some rooms feature attractive sitting areas; others feature bathrooms with a view of the beach, while unique romantic spa rooms welcome guests with an indulgent Jacuzzi facing the magnificent view. All guests are welcome to enjoy the amazing rooftop lounge: is the perfect spot for an afternoon of relaxation.
